Posts.Content: May 15, 2014 11:14PM red_robin wrote: Hi all, seems that oncatype test is a great means of further information but geezze it's a hard decision to make when you're score comes back low!!  I was diagnosed March 14th 2014 had lumpectomy followed by a second lumpectomy as margins weren't clear.  It was a ER and PR positive, HER2 neg 2.7cm cancer, stage 1, grade 3 but with clear nodes.  I'm 36 years old. My score came back at 12 and oncologist suggests that chemo will be of little benefit; I will need radiation and will be on Tamoxifen for 5 years with the addition of zolidex injections for 2 years.  Can't work out if I should do the chemo just in case???  I've been trying to make sense of the test results document myself and am not sure if I understand correctly; there are two aspects - reccurence rate and chemo benefit...mine is 8% reccurence rate and it looks like a negative number on the graph for the benefit of chemo bit.  I'm almost interpreting that as there's nothing I can really do other than radiation and hormone therapy??  Am I stuck in wishful thinking brain??? Doesn't help that I was hoping to have another baby, in fact was trying to conceive when I was diagnosed (scary thought really!)  Chemo can cut my fertility by almost half! Arghhhh, what to do??????????????????? Red Robin
Posts.Title: Oncotype DX test score at 18 - chemo or not? julie775 Bamagirl2016
